title: CDC involvement in the production of "Outbreak" (1995)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) and the production of the 1995 film "Outbreak," directed by Wolfgang Petersen. Such documents may include, but are not limited to, script notes; production assistance agreements; and all records of communications between employees of the CDC and members of the cast, crew, and production company of "Outbreak," including memos, notes of meetings and conference calls, emails, and other forms of communication.

I would also like to know if the CDC provided any form of support or technical advice whatsoever to the production of "Outbreak" or to any member of the cast or crew, or if the production or any member of the cast or crew sought assistance from the CDC in connection with the production of the film.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

title: Valujet Flight 592 Courtroom Animation

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A raw video and audio copy of a 1999 courtroom animation that may have been used in USA v. Sabretech, Inc. in the Florida Southern District Court, which detailed the flight of Valujet Airlines Flight 592 on May 11, 1996. The animation included CGI visuals of the flight and audio from the aircraft’s voice recorder. A copy of the animation can be found on YouTube at https://youtu.be/3k_Mcg6TSHM?si=_Mx6MLmgFtxK4Yh-

If records are found, and any of them are determined to be exempt from disclosure under the Freedom of Information Act, please cite the exemptions used in refusing them.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Joseph Pasteris

title: ShotSpotter / SoundThinking Contract Process Details (City Of Boston -- Public Records Access Officer)

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: ShotSpotter / SoundThinking Contract Process Details (City Of Boston -- Public Records Access Officer)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Documents, emails and text messages relating to the expiration of the current Boston municipal contract with ShotSpotter, discussions of the bidding process for its renewal; anything referring to "Phase I" and "Phase II" of the ShotSpotter coverage area; and anything referring to other expansions of the services or types of services provided by SoundThinking.

In Exhibit B of the current Service Level Agreement, page 114, ShotSpotter (now rebranded as "SoundThinking") commits to detect at least "90% of unsuppressed, outdoor gunfire incidents, using standard, commercially available rounds above .25 caliber [...] Each Service Level measurement shall be determined quarterly, the results of which will be reviewed during the periodic account review meetings with Customer." We specifically request any records relating to these quarterly determinations or periodic account review meetings, and any information relating to adherence or non adherence to the contracted Service Levels, and any information as to how "gunfire incident" is defined.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alex Marthews

title: Hedge Fund Request

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Hedge Fund Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

You kindly sent us copies of your records that show information as listed below dated to March 31 2023. Please will it be possible to have an update on any records that would show some or all of the following information:

1. A list of ALL hedge funds and fund of hedge funds in which Richmond Retirement System is an investor; and

2. For each hedge fund and fund of hedge funds, may I please have a copy of any records that would show some or all of the following information:

a. the month by month market value of Richmond Retirement System's holding in each fund from January 1 2023 to June 30 2023,

b. the month by month amount invested by Richmond Retirement System in each fund from January 1 2023 to June 30 2023,

c. the month by month net returns (net of fees) earned by Richmond Retirement System on its investment in each fund from January 1 2023 to June 30 2023

Additionally we are missing the December 2022 data so we would be grateful if you could include this information aswell.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

Sincerely,

Nanette Lee

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Haley Parker.

title: Banner Learning Corporation

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Banner Learning Corporation
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

This request is being made in response to allegations that the LAUSD does not always operate its Special Education classes, or contracts outside of agency, which allows Contractors to property manage portions of a campus to conduct the education of disabled students, Special Education students.
Furthermore, I request an official list of school sites which have been managed or operated by Banner Learning Corporation, or have had their teachers or staff in facilitative, consultant, assistant, or temporary student facing positions.
In addition I request LAUSD employment history or Contractor history of Sidney Yeldell, an individual referenced in the following article whom now works for Banner Learning Corporation.
https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/1999/03/31/dc-school-security-chief-also-had-cleveland-job-officials-say/85165fab-4c87-4fc8-b652-4ffff4d2a115/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Remy Noìchlaf

communications.subject: Auto Reply
communications.communication:
Hello,

This email is in response to your California Public Records Act (PRA) request.  Your request will be reviewed and the appropriate departments contacted to determine if disclosable records relevant to your request exist.

As required under California Code section 7922.535(a), the Los Angeles Unified School District (District) will make a determination within 10 days as to whether or not a request is seeking records that are publicly disclosable and, if so, to provide the estimated date that the records will be made available.  There is no requirement for a public agency to actually produce the records within 10 days of receiving a request, unless the requested records are readily available.  Still, the District prides itself on always providing all publicly disclosable records in as timely a manner as possible.

Should you have any questions, please contact the Office of the General Counsel at (213) 241-7600.

Thank you.

PLEASE DO NOT RESPOND TO THIS EMAIL.

title: Fast Food Wage Board records provided to Randy Mastro (Office of the Governor - New York)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Fast Food Wage Board records provided to Randy Mastro (Office of the Governor - New York)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

All documents provided to Randy Mastro of Gibson, Dunn & Crutcher, LLP in response to FOIL requests he submitted in 2015. I do not know the tracking number(s), but one such request was submitted to the Office of the Governor on 7/29/2015 for documents pertaining to the Fast Food Wage Board. The requested records include "all documents relating to the selection of the members of the Fast Food Wage Board" and "all documents relating to any Fast Food Wage Board meeting, hearing, or event." 

Note that I am also submitting my request to the New York State Department of Labor since some of the responsive records may be maintained by that agency rather than the Governor's Office.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Peter Fugiel

title: Marine Corps assistance to the production of 1996 movie "The Rock"

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Marine Corps assistance to the production of 1996 movie "The Rock"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any documents pertaining to collaboration between the United States Marine Corps and the production of the 1996 movie "The Rock," directed by Michael Bay. I would like to know if the Marines provided any form of support or technical advice whatsoever to the production or to any member of the cast or crew, or if the production or any member of the cast or crew sought assistance from the Marines in connection with the production of the film.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Brett Carollo

95 M Street, SW 
Washington, DC 20024-3622

Official Code§ 2-537 and 1 DCMR § 412, you have the right to appeal this letter to the Mayoror to the Superior Court of the District of Columbia. If you elect to appeal tothe Mayor, your appeal must be in writing and contain “Freedom of InformationAct Appeal” or “FOIA Appeal” in the subject line of the letter as well on theoutside of the envelope. The appeal must include (1) a copy of the originalrequest; (2) a copy of any written denial; (3) a statement of thecircumstances, reasons, and/or arguments advanced in support of disclosure; and(4) a daytime telephone number, an e-mail and/or U.S. mailing address at whichyou can be reached. The appeal must be mailed to: The Mayor’s Office of Legal Counsel, FOIAAppeal, 1350 Pennsylvania Avenue, N.W., Suite 407 Washington, D.C. 20004. Electronic versions of the sameinformation can instead be e-m ailed to The Mayor’s Office of LegalCounsel at foia.appeals@dc.gov Further, a copy of all appeal materials must be forwardedto the Freedom of Information Officer of the involved agency, or to the agency head of that agency, if there is no designated Freedom of Information Officer there.  Failure to follow these administrative steps will result in delay inthe processing and commencement of a response to your appeal to the Mayor. Regards,  Latrina Crumlin Staff Assistant Freedom of Information Act Office Metropolitan Police Department 300 Indiana Avenue, NW, Rm 4153 Washington, DC 20001

communications.subject: Request for Clarification - AF 2023-06353-F
communications.communication:
Dear Matthew Petti, 
This is to acknowledge receipt of your 22-Sep-23, Freedom of Information Act (FOIA) request for the "following records: Slides from a presentation on "Naruto Running," as made popular by a July 20th, 2019 Reddit post." 
In order for our office to continue to process your request, we need further information related to your request.  In order to locate the records you are seeking we need to know what office, Major Command (MAJCOM) or base created the record you are seeking.  In order for a FOIA request to be processed, the material being requested must describe the records being sought as specifically as specifically as possible. 
Our office will place you request on hold, pending your response, until 28 September 2023.  If we do not hear back from you by that time, we will administratively close your request. 
We have assigned number 2023-06353-F to identify your request; should you need to contact us about your request.  Please direct your questions to SAF.AA.HAF.FOIA.Workflow@us.af.mil and use this assigned number to assist us in responding more promptly. 
Very Respectfully, 
HAF FOIA TEAM 
SAF/AAII (FOIA)

1000 Air Force Pentagon 
Washington, DC 20330-1000

title: Wylie ISD Database Request

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Wylie ISD Database Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Title and Copy List of the district's library catalog including all titles, authors, ISBN and copy information (example copies/location). 

Note: This information can generally be easily retrieved by a district level user of Follett using the Generate a Title & Copy List Report (Library Manager) feature of the Follett catalogue. Instructions are attached and  located here https://legacyhelp.fsc.follett.com/content/t_generate_title_copy_list_report.htm. Please include all titles (regardless of status) and include the categories and circulation statistics. 

Please output the file(s) as Excel.

In the event the report is limited by the 10,000 title limit, please split it the catalogue information into multiple groupings as the report allows. For instance you could limit the titles in each file by selecting groupings A-G and H-Z.

As censorship is at an all time high, we are conducting research on titles that may be most at risk of censorship across Texas. We hope to assist schools in their mission of maintaining young learners critical access to books in their libraries.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities. I have a reasonable expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well established. I discuss and comment on the files online and make them available through non-profits such as the Internet Archive and MuckRock, disseminating them to a large audience. While my research is not limited to this, a great deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the government itself. As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of this particular subject in advance.

Additionally, case law states that “proof of the ability to disseminate the released information to a broad cross- section of the public is not required.” Judicial Watch, Inc. v. Dep’t of Justice, 365 F.3d 1108, 1126 (D.C. Cir. 2004); see Carney v. U.S. Dep’t of Justice, 19 F.3d 807, 814-15 (2d Cir. 1994). Further, courts have held that "qualified because it also had “firm” plans to “publish a number of . . . ‘document sets’” concerning United States foreign and national security policy." Under this criteria, as well, I qualify as a member of the news media.

Additionally, courts have held that the news media status "focuses on the nature of the requester, not its request. The provision requires that the request be “made by” a representative of the news media. Id. § 552(a)(4)(A)(ii)(II). A newspaper reporter, for example, is a representative of the news media regardless of how much interest there is in the story for which he or she is requesting information." As such, the details of the request itself are moot for the purposes of determining the appropriate fee category. As my primary purpose is to inform about government activities by reporting on it and making the raw data available, I request that fees be waived.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sidney Braveword

title: MCSO RIPA Data

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: MCSO RIPA Data
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Please provide records of any and all stop data collected by Marin County Sheriff's Office for transmittal to the Department of Justice in accordance with the Racial and Identity Profiling Act from January 1, 2022 through July 31, 2023. The records should be provided in an Excel spreadsheet or other delimited text format of electronic documentation that complies with the Interface Specifications of the Department of Justice. Cal. Code of Regs, Art. 5, Sec. 999.228.  Where collected, please include responses these two categories recently added by MCSO: “did you know the perceived race prior to the detention” and “was the individual a Marin resident”.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Frank Shinneman
